intro: Facheiroa squamosa subsp. chaetacantha, commonly known as the hairy facheiroa, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its robust stems and the presence of glandular hairs on its leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in montane grasslands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
